metadata.value: Fifteenth century (c.1430) Book of Hours; Latin, Vellum, of English origin. Now in a modern binding. St. Thomas of Canterbury has been removed from the Kalendar, and number of births and deaths pertaining to a particular family have been added to the Kalendar with earliest in 1451. Each page has a partial border with eleven having full borders. Colours are vibrant, there is much burninshed gold, and the foliage designs are intricate. There are eleven historiated initials throughout depicting scenes from the bible.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Book of Hours, wirtten in Latin and on vellum. Of English origin. Includes the hymns of St Katherine of Alexandria, Pslams of the Passion, and feminine prayer which suggests that the original owner was female, perhaps named Katherine. Also includes a Kalendar and Litany. Initial letter of prayer at the end of the Pslams of Passion left unfinished. Early owners indicated as the Babhram family due to birth entries on f.135 v., dating from 1451-1474. Gothic script, fine illuminations. Borders appear on each page, of which eleven full borders are elaborate with designs of foliage, burnished gold and colour.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Book of Hours of English origin. Includes hymn of St Katherine of Alexandria. Thid and the inclusion of eminine prayer occuring after the Psalmds of Passion suggests a female ownership. Also connected to the Babhram family in the 15th century, due to the birth entries on f.135 v of the manuscript. Written in Gothic script, with illuminations, line endings and borders. Initials most likely to be drawn from life, and some are of a grotesque nature. Certain borders are elaborate with foliage, burnished gold and colour.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: This finely illuminated fifteenth century Book of Hours contains vibrant images with intricate foliage designs. The book contains eleven images contained in initials portraying scenes from the Bible: this image depicts the Agony in the Garden.
metadata.label: Description
